intro: Lansbergia setacea, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in winter. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy. Lansbergia setacea is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in containers or as a garden plant.
